channel.title: Integers with colors?(updated...)
channel.description:
I'm a complete newbie for scripting with SCAR. I guess you guys hear that a lot on these forums, though. [s] I want to create a process whereby the page in a browser is refreshed every 3 seconds through the use of F5. I've completed this code, though.
When the page is refreshed, the process seeks out a color(actually, two colors) within a box and the mouse jumps to that place and clicks.[/s]
[s]I know how to do this, though(By the way, is it possible to specify middle click, so that the process can continue even when a new page is opened? I have my mouse set to middle click).[/s]
[s][b]My problem is this[/b]: How do I specify the color? I've seen examples of other scripts that do this, and the colors they specify definitely aren't hex codes. So if I want the mouse to click on a particular color, what information about the color do I need to input?[/s]
Here's the part of the code I'm having problems with. If you spot anything else I've done wrong, please tell me.
This code doesn't currently compile, and I'm not sure why. Looks like something to do with Integers, but as I mentioned, I don't know what their function is.
[code]program New; var x, y: Boolean; begin repeat if (FindColor(x, y, 20, 5625340, 3, 219, 717, 320, 20): Boolean;) or (FindColor(x, y, 20, 13553358, 3, 219, 717, 320, 20): Boolean;) then begin ClickMouseMid(x, y, True); end; until (False); end.[/code]

item.title: Integers with colors?(updated...)
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

program New; var x, y: Boolean; begin repeat if (FindColor(x, y, 5625340, 3, 219, 717, 320)) or (FindColor(x, y, 13553358, 3, 219, 717, 320)) then begin ClickMouseMid(x, y, True); //I dont think there is a procedure called ClickMouseMid end; until (False); end.

Read full topic

item.title: Integers with colors?(updated...)
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t know about middle click, but there is a color picker built in in SCAR.

Read full topic

item.title: Integers with colors?(updated...)
item.dc:creator: @Sonoka Sonoka
item.description:
@Sonoka wrote:

I’m a complete newbie for scripting with SCAR. I guess you guys hear that a lot on these forums, though.
[s]
I want to create a process whereby the page in a browser is refreshed every 3 seconds through the use of F5. I’ve completed this code, though.

When the page is refreshed, the process seeks out a color(actually, two colors) within a box and the mouse jumps to that place and clicks.[/s]

I know how to do this, though(By the way, is it possible to specify middle click, so that the process can continue even when a new page is opened? I have my mouse set to middle click).

My problem is this: How do I specify the color? I’ve seen examples of other scripts that do this, and the colors they specify definitely aren’t hex codes. So if I want the mouse to click on a particular color, what information about the color do I need to input?

Here’s the part of the code I’m having problems with. If you spot anything else I’ve done wrong, please tell me.

This code doesn’t currently compile, and I’m not sure why.
Looks like something to do with Integers, but as I mentioned, I don’t know what their function is.

program New; var x, y: Boolean; begin repeat if (FindColor(x, y, 20, 5625340, 3, 219, 717, 320, 20): Boolean;) or (FindColor(x, y, 20, 13553358, 3, 219, 717, 320, 20): Boolean;) then begin ClickMouseMid(x, y, True); end; until (False); end.

Read full topic
